The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .
The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis 10 years ago. He was admitted to our hospital because of dyspnea on exertion. Echocardiography revealed severe aortic regurgitation and aortic root dilatation. He underwent aortic valve replacement and aortic root replacement with a composite graft. The postoperative course was uneventful. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .
The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis 10 years ago. He was admitted to our hospital because of dyspnea on exertion. Echocardiography revealed severe aortic regurgitation and aortic root dilatation. He underwent aortic valve replacement and aortic root replacement with a composite graft. The postoperative course was uneventful. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .
The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis 10 years ago. He was admitted to our hospital because of dyspnea on exertion. Echocardiography revealed severe aortic regurgitation and aortic root dilatation. He underwent aortic valve replacement and aortic root replacement with a composite graft. The postoperative course was uneventful. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The postoperative course was uneventful. .

Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .

The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse who presented with a 2-month history of progressive dyspnea and cough. Chest radiography showed bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The patient was treated with antibiotics and steroids without improvement. A transbronchial biopsy was performed and the histological examination showed a diffuse alveolar damage. The patient died 2 months after the onset of symptoms. The autopsy revealed a diffuse alveolar damage with a marked fibroblastic proliferation. The diagnosis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was made. The authors discuss the clinical, radiological and pathological features of this disease. .
The authors report a case of a 45-year-old man with a history of aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis 10 years ago. He was admitted to our hospital because of dyspnea on exertion. Echocardiography revealed severe aortic regurgitation and aortic root dilatation. He underwent aortic valve replacement and aortic root replacement with a composite graft. The postoperative course was uneventful. .
